com.stripe.android.view

Class CardInputWidget

  • com.stripe.android.view.CardInputWidget

  • public class CardInputWidget

    A card input widget that handles all animation on its own.

    • Constructor Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getPaymentMethodCard

        public PaymentMethodCreateParams.Card getPaymentMethodCard()

        Gets a class PaymentMethodCreateParams.Card object from the user input, if all fields are valid. If not, returns null.

        Returns:
        a valid class PaymentMethodCreateParams.Card object based on user input, or null if any field is invalid
        See Also:
        class PaymentMethodCreateParams.Card

      • getPaymentMethodCreateParams

        public PaymentMethodCreateParams getPaymentMethodCreateParams()
        Returns:
        a valid class PaymentMethodCreateParams object based on user input, or null if any field is invalid. The object will include any billing details that the user entered.

      • getCard

        public Card getCard()

        Gets a class Card object from the user input, if all fields are valid. If not, returns null.

        Returns:
        a valid class Card object based on user input, or null if any field is invalid
        See Also:
        class Card

      • getCardBuilder

        public Card.Builder getCardBuilder()

      • setCardInputListener

        public void setCardInputListener(CardInputListener listener)

        Set a interface CardInputListener to be notified of card input events.

        Parameters:
        listener - the listener
        See Also:
        interface CardInputListener

      • setCardNumber

        public void setCardNumber(java.lang.String cardNumber)

        Set the card number. Method does not change text field focus.

        Parameters:
        cardNumber - card number to be set

      • setCardHint

        public void setCardHint(java.lang.String cardHint)

      • setExpiryDate

        public void setExpiryDate(int month,
                          int year)

        Set the expiration date. Method invokes completion listener and changes focus to the CVC field if a valid date is entered.

        Note that while a four-digit and two-digit year will both work, information beyond the tens digit of a year will be truncated. Logic elsewhere in the SDK makes assumptions about what century is implied by various two-digit years, and will override any information provided here.

        Parameters:
        month - a month of the year, represented as a number between 1 and 12
        year - a year number, either in two-digit form or four-digit form

      • setCvcCode

        public void setCvcCode(java.lang.String cvcCode)

        Set the CVC value for the card. Note that the maximum length is assumed to be 3, unless the brand of the card has already been set (by setting the card number).

        Parameters:
        cvcCode - the CVC value to be set

      • clear

        public void clear()

        Clear all text fields in the CardInputWidget.

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean isEnabled)

        Enable or disable text fields

        Parameters:
        isEnabled - boolean indicating whether fields should be enabled

      • setCardNumberTextWatcher

        public void setCardNumberTextWatcher(android.text.TextWatcher cardNumberTextWatcher)

        Expose a text watcher to receive updates when the card number is changed.

      • setExpiryDateTextWatcher

        public void setExpiryDateTextWatcher(android.text.TextWatcher expiryDateTextWatcher)

        Expose a text watcher to receive updates when the expiry date is changed.

      • setCvcNumberTextWatcher

        public void setCvcNumberTextWatcher(android.text.TextWatcher cvcNumberTextWatcher)

        Expose a text watcher to receive updates when the cvc number is changed.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()

        Override of View.isEnabled that returns true only if all three sub-controls are enabled.

        Returns:
        true if the card number field, expiry field, and cvc field are enabled, false otherwise
        See Also:
        View.isEnabled
